Then helped to organize our transit to the cruise terminal the next morning. When we arrived at the hotel, Anthony personally took care of all our issues and even upgraded us from the Queen to the King Deluxe at no cost. What started as a possible headache, turned into a wonderful day. All thanks to the Best of the West service provided by Anthony and Natasha. I'm going to write a personal letter to their corporate headquarter's to commend these two for their fine service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Janab1000
Reviews.Content: Got a really good last minute deal. It isn't fancy, but it is super clean, the staff super friendly and accomodating. Even at the bar, the drinks were ample for a good price. Extended parking option while we were away on a cruise also offered great rates in comparison to nearby park n' fly's.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gal Natasha is!!!”
Reviews.Author: twodaynews
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made for a two queen bed handicapped room for 7 nights. We arrived and were presented with a one queen bed, in a very small handicapped room. No other options. My husband is on oxygen 24/7 and requires night mask, etc, so the night was not good. We decided to check out, and upon arrival at the desk, Natasha asked how our stay was, and I told her I was unhappy. She let me vent and then in the sweetest voice, said, "Didn't they tell you about room 180". At that point I thought it might be a bar and was ready to go. I was exhausted from a long drive, no sleep and the thought of moving all this equipment luggage, enough for a week, alone, again, was nothing I was looking forward to. I was whisked away to room 180 which was a dream come true, large enough for all his medical equipment, and room to walk around, a walk in tub, which was all we really needed insofar as help in the bathroom and we were in heaven. Our trip was unexpected, a death in the family, and to find someone who took the time to listen and help was a miracle. You have a gem in Natasha. I would recommend that you check with people who ask for handicapped rooms if the walk in shower is adequate for the handicapped needs. Also if the people who answer the phones could slow down. Many times we were calling on cell phones to make reservations and the road noise makes understanding difficult and they rattle off the name of the hotel very quickly. In one instance, we would have stayed at a Best Western, but were unable to understand the person because of language difficulties. Again Natasha is what every Best Western needs. Compassion, courtesy and knowledge of the property. What a Gal, Natasha.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: supertraveler65
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. All of our needs were met. Elizabeth and Jennifer were the best. They booked our tours for City of Seattle and Mount Rainer, provided all the necessary times to be in the lobby and checked when the bus was late. Chris, the waitress in the dinning room was the best. She is one of the most outstanding waitresses I have ever had in all of my travels. James and Daryl your shuttle bus drivers were always available, reliable, friendly, helpful and gave wonderful directions. I will highly recommend this hotel to my friends and co-workers. I will stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Darryl the shuttle driver made everything worth it!”
Reviews.Author: jessbuddah225
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great all around! We had a nice room with a great breakfast, but the best part by far was our driver Darryl. He gave us suggestions on where to eat, and dropped us off with curbside service, even openinng the door to the restaurant for us. I wish all hotels or any business for that matter, had employees a dedicated to service as he was. I will stay here as long as Darryl is available!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: tcomm1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 18th on a late night arrival and early morning departure out of Sea-Tac. Room was clean and comforable and quiet. Front desk staff were pleasant and friendly and the shuttle to and from the airport were quick and on time. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Used there Stay, Park and Fly Package”
Reviews.Author: hbulcock30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on May 9th for one night prior to flying out of SEA TAC. We used there 7 day stay park and fly. Stay 1 night and park your car for 7 days while you were away. Much cheaper then airport parking. When we pulled up I was a little nervous as the front part of the hotel was ripped apart. Looked like they were getting ready to start renos. We booked here as they offer a stay park package, free 24 hour shuttle and indoor pool. Upon arrival we found out the pool was closed, my son was very disappointed as this was one of the main reasons we booked here. Room was very clean. beds was comfortable. Front desk staff on check in were very friendly and efficent. We checked out on May 10th at 3am. We had a very early flight. The gentlemen checking us out was very rude and snappy with us. He tried to charge my cedit card a second time even though I pre paid on line. I had to go through my suite cases to get the proof which I had already provided at check in. We did use the shuttle to get us to the airport. The shuttle driver was amazing. Very friendly. He went out of his way to ensure we knew were to be picked up from on our return. Thanks so much to him for his great service. When we arrived back at SEA TAC the same shuttle driver picked us up. He was amazing and very helpful with his directions to get us back ont he freeway home again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, professional management, good value”
Reviews.Author: travelguyuth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Seatac airport. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. There was a lot of space in the rooms including a work space with a desk and office chair. The check-in went very smoothy and was professional. The shuttle driver was very professional and courteous. He recommended a restaurant for us to eat in and very pleasant to be around. Of all of the hotels we have stayed at in Seatac, this was the best and the best value as well.

Reviews.Title: “funky smell in room - fantastic breakfast - close to airport”
Reviews.Author: glebo
Reviews.Content: room had an old time motel smell - but seemed clean - could use a thorough cleaning behind night stand and in the bathroom - bed should be replaced...we rolled to the middle :{ Breakfast was incredible - friendly staff and real plates and silverware. a small bar for an evening drink if you get in before 10:00 p.m. A good place to stay for a night after traveling. good price when you include the good breakfast menu

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovations But Nice”
Reviews.Author: tipijo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our Cruise before we went home the next day. The staff were very nice and made arrangements to shuttle us to the airport. There shuttle runs every 1/2 hour. The rooms were very clean and so was the bathroom. I saw housekeeping constantly vacuuming and dusting the hallways. The pool was under renovations so I couldn't use it but I went and looked at the area. It will be nice when done. My husband was under the weather and stayed in bed all day and ate ice cream. I went in the restaurant and had one of the best tasting steaks I have ever eaten. The women that run the restaurant were great. I used the business center to print out our boarding passes. The airport is just a mile from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “older hotel but very clean and good price”
Reviews.Author: gloria075
Reviews.Content: Hotel very reasonable priced. We were just staying the night. At the hotel less than 12 hours, awating a connecting flight to final destination. Great and reliable 24 hours shuttle and continental breakfast with early start hour....5 am. Older building and not fancy at all, but no smells, and felt like it was very clean. Beds were very comfortable, nice shower. Quiet, felt safe. Quick check in and out, friendly staff. They were helpful on phone and efficient to arrange the shuttle pickup. Good van for shuttle and good driver.

Reviews.Title: “I will return.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingHereThere
Reviews.Content: Our suite was spotlessly clean. Some hotels cover the beds with bedspreads that are so huge that I suspect they are seldom washed. However, all the bed linens here were of a size that can be washed between guests. In fact, in my wanderings through the hallways, I saw the cleaning staff completely strip the beds in order to replace the bed linens with clean ones, blankets included. This Best Western also offers a TV remote control that can be thoroughly wiped clean. Our room had good water pressure in the shower, ample lighting, a small refrigerator, and good climate control.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: MGMJJJ
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay of two nights, with delicious breakfast, nice beds to sleep, pool to swim, and spa to relax. It is non-smoking facility!!!. Would recommend to my friends. Few things my husband added - in the pool area some people would go outside and smoke, that was not pleasant, and another thing on our second night stay we could hear doors closing loudly again and again, that affected our sleep for a while. Everything else were great!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Campcoho
Reviews.Content: Spent two terrible days here this week. When we checked in we were not told that there were ongoing issues with the plumbing system. The hotel's plumbing system was only capable of delivering hot scalding water...no cold water at all. When we reported the issue to the front desk, the staff was rather snotty and told me that mechanics were resolving the problem. So we decided to stay for our second planned night. But alas no correction of the problem. It was so hot (the water) that it heated the room to the point we had to turn on the air conditioner! The hot water running through the toilet apparently caused a gasket to fail, flooding the bathroom. It was impossible to take a shower; the water was so hot that is was unbearable and would cause 3rd degrees burns. When I complained to the front desk staff upon checkout I was told..."Hey we just work here. Call the owner if you want to speak to someone who cares." Well I have stayed at this hotel for all my SEATAC overnight stays over the last 20+ years. This week was my last stay. Do yourself a favor and find another hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient & good value.”
Reviews.Author: frugalfolks
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room with 2 beds, good towels, good beds, extensive decent breakfast, near airport, 1/2 hour from Seattle/Pike Market/Etc. Motel restaurant has a few good choices for dinner, but....the waitresses could be friendlier. When one passed us with the water pitcher & we asked for some, she kept going & said "hold on". Really? Room was $72+tax, but our friends paid $61 through Travelocity. Wish we had known that! Close by in Burien is the little ferry to Vashon Island. Lovely, rural island with great cafe on dowtown corner & well worth the side trip if you have time. Author Betty McDonald's (The Egg & I) home is near the ferry & a B&B now.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, short drive to downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ChrismanFamily
Reviews.Content: Awesome indoor pool under a glass atrium. Relaxing jacuzzi. The front desk staff is a little snooty but a nicely placed comment tends to knock them down a notch or two. The Boulevard Cafe has limited selections that are slightly overpriced. Our room was cozy but a little cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Lot like Website - won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: npalmer1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tired looking, the bathroom was clean. The shuttle driver "Daryl" was the best part of the visit, very accomodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: njgraves
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to a dog! The service is the worst ever. Staff was extremely unpleasant, especially in the cafe. The food in the cafe takes forever and the femare the worst servers I have ever encountered. Chris complained about the chef and other employees in front of customers. Norma smacked her lips and rolled her eyes when I asked for hot water. There is no microwave access. Staff has an issue with warming up food and booking rooms. Apparently, the staff likes to pick and choose who they rent rooms to because we were told they had no rooms, but when we called the 800 number, we found that there were rooms available. Staff is overly concerned about towels, silverware, cups, blankets and other things. Unfortunately, they tend to believe that everyone wants their rags. We don't! I was offended by this kind of behavior. Furthermore, people were talking about Norma and Chris’s horrible service in the pool area. Everyone agreed that this was not a place to return to. The pool caused rashes on our skin. Do not use the restaurant, very unpleasant older ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Warmer”
Reviews.Author: Shout2g
Reviews.Content: Since I was tired and arrived late, I didn't take the time to register this complaint - until the next morning: no heat! No matter what I tried to do, the heating unit would not turn on. I even rebooted the plug! So... I slept in my clothes! Secondly, the toilet rim was disgusting. Most people probably wouldn't notice, but... Then, the morning front desk clerk was rather blasé about my request to check out after the usual hour, but said that was fine. However, when I walked by again, she grabbed me to ask me when I was checking out! I sensed kind of a personality clash going on, I think. :0) I've used BW's before, so I was rather surprised about all of this.

Reviews.Title: “Never picked me up from the airport”
Reviews.Author: epk02
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its close proximity to the airport and the free 24 hr airport shuttle. When I booked the room I was told to call the hotel when I was ready to be picked-up from the airport. Well, I arrived at 10pm and called the front desk of the hotel for 1/2 hour and NO ONE ever picked-up the phone. I had to take a cab to the hotel. When I arrived the front desk clerk did not seem to care, and did not have a good excuse for not answering the phone. They need to hire someone who knows how to answer a telephone.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed with hidden parking charges - will not return”
Reviews.Author: DebAndKev
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, doing a sleep/park and fly package. That time we parked for 12 nights and were charged what we were quoted online. It was fine. This time we parked for 14 nights prior to staying there. We were charged an additional $40 over what we were quoted for parking. APPARENTLY they have a 7 night package and a 14 night sleep and fly package. Funny, but it stated that no where on the website. When I mentioned this the staff shrugged me off. In fact, the staff were not very friendly or helpful. So we ended up paying $170 PULS taxes for 1 night plus parking. Pretty steep I think for an average airport hotel, particulalry when most are offering great deals these days. The room was clean and comfortable, but the walls are paper thin and I heard people walking and showering above us before very early flights. Also, what's with the selling of cheap white hotel towels? Found that rather tacky. We are Best Western rewards members, but we are very disappointed with the service at this one. We will not return. Next time we'll find another hotel that doesn't sneak in hidden charges at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: lemon-peppa
Reviews.Content: Pros - Close to airport, free shuttle (book when you need it), free breakfast, free parking, close to restaurants, clean rooms, friendly staff. Cons - I am a heavy sleeper and planes taking off kept waking me up. If you stay here take some ear plugs. Strange smell in bathroom and hallway in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: E-Equals-MC2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for a post flight stay. It was nice and close to the airport. The shuttle was prompt. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was the usual hotel continental. I choose not to eat it. My car was intact when I returned from my vacation a week later. This hotel is not a 5* resort, but it served my purposes well.

Reviews.Title: “A typical OLD dilapidated Best Western; OK for 1 night, maybe”
Reviews.Author: Cepage
Reviews.Content: This place is basically an old dump, very typical of many old Best Western hotels and not at all like a newer Holiday Inn Express or Hampton Inn, if you want something to compare to. The rooms have been modernized to an extent, as have the bathrooms, however the overall feel to the place is very much 1970s. Sound insulation is NOT good, at least it was not good in my room, and overhead jet noise was very noticeable. Fortunately, there is not all that much activity at the SeaTac airport between the hours of about midnight and 5 am. The breakfast was ordinary. I waited quite a while for the free airport shuttle on arrival even though I was told that it was already on its way when I called. I had no problems with the personnel and everyone was reasonably friendly. The wireless internet worked well. Would I stay here again? If my stay was only going to be for 8 hours or so, yes. If I was going to be in the hotel for a whole day or more, the answer is a definite NO.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine-- bus to airport, breakfast better than expected”
Reviews.Author: perrysburg
Reviews.Content: Life is all about expectations! We had expected the Best Western to be worse than the nearby Holiday Inn Express down the street, where we had stayed the week before. In fact, it was an equivalent experience and a lower price. We had expected the breakfast to be only coffee and rolls, but there was a better (typical) breakfast buffet in a restaurant room instead. The bus to the airport was fine. The rooms were a bit dated but spacious. Room rate was only $84 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “no wake up call and almost missed flight”
Reviews.Author: ctossa
Reviews.Content: We ate at the restaurant onsite when we checked in... we didn't have any problems until the morning of our flight! I had requested a wake up call for our early morning flight and they NEVER CALLED US!!! We scrambled to get ready, missed our free breakfast and almost missed our shuttle to the airport.... When i told the front desk about it they said sorry and that we weren't on the list for a wake up call. She also said that our account had been settled already as we had prepaid through expedia. We chose the park and fly 7 day package... when we arrived at the airport we requested for the shuttle 3 times in a span of 30 minutes... my husband saw their shuttle, so we ran a few stations closer... had we stayed where we were the shuttle would've been full... we got the last 2 seats... i felt sorry for the other groups that were waiting for this same shuttle... i overheard some people say... wow that was fast we only waited 5 minutes! They really need a better system... I called and spoke with the hotel manager and told him our experience and had said that he was sorry and that he would look into it and call me back... we still haven't heard anything and it has been over a week. We were going to stay there again with our extended family over the christmas holidays but have decided against it as we had a HORRIBLE experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pariz
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of staying at this hotel 9/4/10-9/6/10. Everything was perfect. The staff was helpful and our room was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay if you are sight seeing or visiting”
Reviews.Author: true2u_60644
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice it is small not a lot of move around room but very clean and comfortable. The bed was great not lumps clean and fresh pillows the carpet was clean and the bathroom was clean. Small single cup coffee maker nice touch and the dispenser for soap and shampoo my children loved! We did not get a chance to checkout the pool but we saw a few people relaxing in the jacuzzi.... looked relaxing. We took the suttle service from the airport to the hotel and to the train to go downtown the next day. The shutlle drivers where nice and they drop you right in front of the train station and will pick you up from there if you call once you get there. The food was good at the hotel we ate dinner there our first night there the fired shimp were very good and the pizza we had with the articokes minus the bacon was excellent! Service was nice and friendly and you can just charge it to your room that worked out since I was using the same credit card. Breakfast was average nothing fancy biscuts and gravy boiled eggs one morning and fried eggs the next waffels every morning cereal oatmeal juices and coffee and toast no donuts or rolls during our three nights stay. Free internet service in room or in lobby. I would stay there again just for the price used my AAA discount the only reason I wouldnot stay here is if I needed to be closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “It was an alright stay.”
Reviews.Author: the_1and_only1290
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while picking up my sister from the airport. The lobby looks very nice. The hallways made me feel like i was walking into a very old appartment buliding walls had smears of all kinds. Doors to rooms look like they could be broke into very easily. The layout of the room was kind of strange. You can't really see the TV from the bed. The bed was very comfortable. The restaurant was very good! I was expecting small portions because of the price but they give you plenty. Plus the gentleman working there was great! Very helpful and friendly! The breakfast was okay. Nothing special. Lady at the front desk didn't greet me when I walked in or smile at all while I was checking in. Didn't seem like she cared much and just wated to go home. One thing I did find very helpful was an extra blanket in the dresser. The internet also worked great! Overall the stay was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off Seatac airport”
Reviews.Author: Ondrej_Pavla
Reviews.Content: This clean and nice Best Western hotel is 5 mins off Seatac airport by free hotel shuttle. The price includes breakfast. The staff is very nice and helpful. Downtown Seattle is about an hour away.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Park,Stay,Fly.”
Reviews.Author: eep69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Did park & fly. Girls working front desk were great,friendly & professional! Room was fine & had everything we needed including WiFi. Breakfast was great & shuttle left as scheduled. A great start to our vacation began here & would definatly book again if flying out of Sea-Tac.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this place”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: Traveling for business I searched Trip Advisor reviews for hotels in the Seattle area. I decided on the Best Western Executel. The room was comfortable not too small-roomy enough. The drinks at the bar were very reasonably priced. The food was good. The room and facilities were clean. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very nice. This Best Western was an excellent value and one of the better priced hotels in the area. Also, if you're looking for the best deal on car rentals in the area check out Fox Rent A Car. It's a regional company and much better priced than the others, especially during peak times of the year. They also provide free transportation to and from the airport. It's just down the road from the Best Western. I am forever grateful to everyone who writes reviews in Trip Advisor---THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, recently updated, perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy O
Reviews.Content: We flew into Seattle late and were pleased to stay here. Our room looked brand new. Typical Best Western complimentary breakfast: waffles, fruit, cereal etc. With AARP our bill was under $100.00 including all taxes and fees. Next time we are there we will stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dreamin_10
Reviews.Content: The lock on the entry door to the hotel was duct taped closed so that anyone could enter the building without a hotel key. The towels were gray, not white, and the room table was filled with papers about scams and thieves at the hotel. This hotel should be closed until it is remodeled and made secure.

Reviews.Title: “very good, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: BillandEllie
Reviews.Content: Located a little way from the airport, this hotel lived up to it's good ratings. The front desk was friendly and very willing to help. I was staying a few nights with my daughter, asked for a larger room and they accommodated us no problem & no extra charge. The beds were comfortable, the towels fluffy & soft even the restaurant had a good stir fry which was a surprise. The staff apologized over & over for the time it took to get my meal, everyone ordering at once. If planes taking off bother you, ask for a room near the front of the hotel. We were fine with it, some might not be. Overall a very pleasant stay with very good service. Hats off to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: LuverOfTraveling
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to Seattle, and it took me a few days to find a hotel that offered the amenities I was looking for, for a decent price and not too far from Seattle's City Center. I wanted a hotel that offered free wireless internet, an in-room mini refrigerator and free parking, and the Best Western Airport Executel offers them all.... along with a 'free' Deluxe Breakfast (which isn't a big deal to me anyway). The hotel room is small in size, decorated nicely and very clean, but the hotel could use some updating with their in-room carpet and the hallways from ceiling to the floor. Also, the hotel hallways smell old. My first night there, sheets on both beds had stains on them, and due to arriving at the hotel late at night, I placed clean bath towels on the stains, and left a note the next day, requesting new sheets from housekeeping.... which was done the next day. The hotel is located in an okay neighborhood, with eating places not too far away as well as a Safeway market to buy beverages to keep inside of the mini refrigerator. If I were on a budget, staying in Seattle, I'd probably stay there again, otherwise, I'd probably choose a hotel in the Downtown area, just to experience being closer to most tourist destinations. As for noise, there are times during the day when you can hear airlines taking off or landing at SeaTac Airport, but it's not really bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise finally a great find in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: alleyca21t
Reviews.Content: WE had a reservation at the Red Roof Inn before our cruise. It was so disgusting that we said we need to sleep in our car or try to find another hotel. It was mid night and lucky enough Best Western had a room it was thirty dollars more but it was worth not feeling like you had cooties on you. Last year we tried the extended stay before the cruise and it was so gross. Finally we found a place that is clean, good parking area, nice breakfast, pretty room. We will stay here from now on before taking a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: Alphawolf71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect way to round out a trip or to get it started. Location was excellent, a mere 10 minutes from SEA-TAC Airport, even better with their free airport shuttle. Their rooms were in excellent condition with soft towels, moderately firm pillows, extra blankets, and springy mattresses. The bathroom was very spacious and a good selection of coffee and teas in the room to choose from. The room has a nice roomy feel with the nice soft carpets while the hotel replaced the traditional bottles of shampoo and conditioners with a wall mounted dispenser for shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. Breakfast was nice with a added degree of excellence in providing muffins and juice in the lobby for extra early morning travelers. Parking lots are pretty well lit and close to the rooms. Only 2 minor details prevented my stay from being an over the top experience: lack of parking space and the fitness room. I hope that in the near future they can expand the number of parking spaces that they have because at times, it becomes a competition to try and find spaces to park. The fitness room only had three machines which consisted of 2 stationary bikes and a treadmill. Due to its close proximity to the indoor swimming pool, it was extremely humid and smelled heavily of chlorine. I recommend that they get a couple more different types of workout machines and to better ventilate and air condition the fitness room. Other than that, excellent hotel, excellent stay. The hotel carried the Best Western brand extremely well and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: IslandFlyBoy
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about this motel! I wanted a clean, comfortable and affordable place to stay overnight between flights out of SEA, and I got just that at the BW Executel. I thought my room was wonderful. It was a pretty large room with a king size bed, and I had the sense that it had recently been renovated. The contemporary furnishings in the room reminded me more of a Hilton or Marriott hotel, rather than a Best Western. The bed was so comfortable, with an ample supply of pillows, and I had a very restful nights sleep. The room included free wi-fi access, a refrigerator, nice new television, a great work space, and a clean, large bathroom. It was also very quiet. No noise from other rooms or from the exterior. There was a nice breakfast bar in the morning and a complimentary USA Today newspaper. Although the motel is located about 2 miles from the airport, it was easy to get there with the complimentary hotel shuttle that departed every 30 minutes. I paid less than $100 for this room for my overnight stay which I felt was a bargain. Based on this experience, I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but we won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlWashington
Reviews.Content: This place kind of reeked of indifference. The ambience is not-very-clean and pretty outdated. We stayed for one night and took advantage of their very reasonably priced park-sleep-fly package. The high points included their breakfast buffet and the fact that our car was undamaged when we returned. The low points were the very rude receptionist the night we checked in and the very inconsistent information we received from the various people we spoke with. We were directed to park out in back of the hotel, in one of two separate lots, both of which are dark and largely unlighted at night. When I asked on the phone about recent car break-ins, I was told there hadn't been one in months. When we asked at check-in, the receptionist smirked and said "last week." He also neglected to mention that we needed to sign up in advance for the airport shuttle, so we ended up with a last-minute scramble to get to the airport on time. Fortunately, the morning receptionist was very responsive and apologetic and they got us there. She also told us we could park in the actual hotel lot, as long as our car was towards the back. That's what we did. In a nutshell, the helpful and rude employees kind of balanced each other out and it all ended up okay. But I'll look for someplace else next time -- might spend a little more, but it would be nice to avoid last minute hassles and annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Fast Overnight Stay Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Two-For-Texas
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because we wanted a lower cost, but safe place to stay in order to catch a very early flight out of SeaTac the next day. For this purpose, we seek motels or hotels close to the airport with a gas station nearby for fueling the rental car and an informal dining place for refueling ourselves. We try to stay in the $70 to $90 a range for these one night stands. Arriving at check in, we found ample free parking on site, but a long line tour group checking in. As soon as the front desk person noticed I was not with the group, she opened a new position and efficiently checked me in. We borrowed a hotel luggage cart to take our stuff to our room. After we got everything repacked for our flight scheduled for 0630 the next day, we drove a few blocks North to eat at Dave's Diner, a Route 66 themed, old style family diner with a good selection of comfort food. Stuffed, we drove South and filled up the car too. Then back to the hotel to catch some shut eye before our 0415 alarm would go off. The hotel also has a restaurant on site, but we did not try it out on this trip. Up early, fast checkout, and we had our car efficiently checked back in at AVIS, got through Security before the lines formed and sat down to a leisurely coffee and bagel. Best Western Microtel met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: TeresaWebb
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and had a group going on an Alaskan cruise from Seattle. Best Western is my favorite chain; I have never had a bad experience with them so I chose the Best Western Airport Executel to stay the night before the cruise. Our flight was postponed until the next day so we didn't need the rooms. However we didn't know this until 2 1/2 hours after the deadline for cancellations. I called the hotel and spoke with Jennifer, told her the situation. Nadeem, the hotel manager said they would see the what they could do. Jennifer called me back about 1/2 hour later and said they would cancel the rooms at no charge. This was great, my group was happy, I was happy! I can't say anything about the hotel itself but I can say they are very cooperative and easy to work with. I can't wait to go back to Seattle so I can stay at the BWAE

Reviews.Title: “Average airport hotel, clean, free parking, but less than average sleep quality.”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Samantha
Reviews.Content: Typical Best Western hotel. It is clean and very convenient to the airport. Free parking, which is a big plus around the SeaTac airport. It was a very hot day, the AC unit had a screeching noise that would keep you up at night, good thing we brought ear plugs. At least the AC unit was working well. Continental breakfast was a huge disappointment. The biggest spread of nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay overall, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: NavyNurse1998
Reviews.Content: I like staying at Best Western Hotels so I chose this one because of the price and close proximity to the airport. As other reviewers have said (on Tripadvisor, other websites) the hotel doesn't have curb appeal, but is nice inside. The check-in process was smooth, the clerk was extremely nice. The room seemed a tad smaller than other BWs I've stayed in; it actually felt a little cramped with the 4 of us and 6 pieces of luggage. The decor is pretty standard, but the room was very clean, smelled nice, was not dusty and the bathroom was spotless. The bath linens were very clean, but were old- those could use replacing. We like BW because of the free, warm breakfasts, but the breakfast at this location doesn't compare with other BWs. There was the make-your-own-waffles station that was packed, no scrambled eggs, or bacon/sausage. The biscuits were stale tasting, gravy was okay. The cereal and boiled eggs were fine, as was the yogurt and cereal. We were disappointed with that as other BWs have more breakfast items. As for the area of SeaTac, I wish I knew more about the area before booking it. We are from north of Seattle and SeaTac looks nothing like our area; many thuggish-looking people walking the streets, people blasting unpleasant music from their vehicles, some businesses nearby looked unsafe. Went to the Federal Way area and saw a BW Evergreen and that looked like a much nicer location. But, we chose this particular hotel for the rate and proximity to the airport, so we stuck with it. Pool and hot tub were great. Fitness area has 3-4 machines.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but Acceptable Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: CK2009
Reviews.Content: Finding an affordable hotel near SeaTac airport has always been a struggle - either expensive and nice, or cheap and a dive. The Best Western Executel seems to be a good middle-ground - inexpensive but perfectly fine for a night or two near the airport. We stayed in a deluxe room with King Size bed and sofabed (for our daughter). Mattress on KS bed was good (hotel sofabed mattresses are NEVER good - no exception here). Indoor pool was OK, though hot tub was not working when we were there. Some noise from unil upstairs (people walking on floor) and definitely airplane noise in the morning - comes part and parcel to being near an airport I suspect. Deluxe continental breakfast was good - waffle maker, yogurt, cereals, juice, breakfast breads, etc. Free parking as well. All in all, just fine for a night or two. Oh, and the free airport shuttle was quick and convenient (at least for my late evening arrival).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for over-nighter”
Reviews.Author: ozmomof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we set out on a week long trip of Seattle and surrounds. This hotel was perfect! The room was clean as was the entire hotel. It's only about a five minute drive from the airport. The shuttle is very convenient. The restaurant was excellent for dinner and served Ivar's famous Clam Chowder which was delicious! The room was small but very adequate. Breakfast in the morning was great and the dining area large which was nice so everyone was not crowded in one small area like so many hotels. The pool and hot tub were a welcome addition to our children who just love indoor pools. The only reason why I gave service four stars was because when I requested towels for the pool area none ever came. We ended up searching some down in the restrooms. There were no clean towels by the pool side. This hotel is just perfect for an overnighter.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: aventura6707
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night prior to our Alaska cruise. It has complimentary airport shuttle service to the hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were clean, the staff friendly. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. All in all, a very good choice and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and very clean”
Reviews.Author: stoss19
Reviews.Content: Good location to the airport with 24 hour free shuttle service. The rooms were very clean. There was a free breakfast in the morning. Hotel was great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Dark rooms, noisy hallway, no frills”
Reviews.Author: solar6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to an early morning flight. Although the room was clean, it was cluttered and dark. The room picture posted does NOT look like the room we stayed in. The hallways were dark as well and on the night we were there, there was a lot of noise. Fortunately, no plane noise could be heard at any time. The breakfast was very heavy on carbohydrates; waffles, pastries, toast, cereal. For gluten free diets, not many options except eggs which were rubbery, flavorless discs. Check-in/out were unremarkable - I would have preferred more professional attire from the staff rather than a cotton t-shirt (female). I wouldn't stay here again as there are too many other options in the Seatac area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for pre-cruise stay in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: doreo
Reviews.Content: We flew into Seattle for a cruise starting the next day. Shuttle promptly picked us up at the airport and delivered us to the hotel. Helpful desk clerks told us how to get the Light Rail train and monorail to the downtown Seattle area and Space Needle. Two blocks up the street was a Safeway where we stocked up on wine and sodas for the cruise. Hot tub and pool were refreshing and clean. Dinner downstairs at the hotel was great -- and a wonderful buffet breakfast awaited us in the morning. Not one complaint but lots of accolades for the friendly staff and clean accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sunwor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel when we needed to catch an early morning flight from seattle. Even though I had read the trip advisor's (mainly) good reports, I was a little hesitant as the hotel pictures made it look a little run down. This hotel turned out to be a real gem. The two girls at the front desk were very friendly and helped out with giving us a quiet room and helping us get to a good restaurant. The room was clean with modern decor and my husband claimed it was one of the better sleeps he has had. They have a pool and hot tub that actually work and are a nice temperature. The wake up call and shuttle to the airport was flawless. We parked our car in their lot and when we returned they picked us up and we just went to the lot and got our car and drove off. Very easy.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best airport hotel I've...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best airport hotel I've stayed in and is excellent value. Superbly helpful and friendly staff. It offers a really good inclusive continental breakfast and a good free shuttle service. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again if I was in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a layover”
Reviews.Author: MauiColoradoTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times now in the past 6 months while on a layover. HUGE TIP: Join Best Western Rewards before you book and you will get at MUCH nicer room. I didn't do it the first trip and was incredulous how much nicer my room was the next time, and they give you bottles of water in your room as a Rewards member. Either way, I noticed all the really negative reviews were pretty much from 2008 and before. I'm guessing this hotel has made some major improvements, as I found the shuttle drivers to be super friendly and helpful, even taking me to Taco Bell at 11 at night, the front desk staff was great, and the breakfast even pretty decent. They have those cook-your-own waffle makers that make really good waffles. And also full continental and even hard-boiled eggs and sausage or bacon. Also free internet. For the price in that area, I feel it's a very good value. Sure, I could spend twice as much for the Doubletree but when you just need a bed for 6-8 hours is it really worth it?

Reviews.Title: “More bang for your buck near Sea-Tac...”
Reviews.Author: Kristophoros
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night based on the impressive tripadviser reviews and I was very pleased with the choice. PROS: The hotel shuttle promptly picked me up from Sea-Tac after I called the hotel. The shuttle driver was very polite and offered to drive me to additional places (i.e. restaurants) during my stay for free. My room was very clean, spacious, modern, and comfy. There is a business center with three computers for internet access, in addition to Wi-Fi in the rooms. The pool was clean and the jacuzzi was warm, however, the sauna was down. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, and the complimentary continental breakfast was good and complete. It included biscuits and gravy, hard-boiled eggs, selection of toasts (with great raisin bread), yogurt, cereal, waffles, milk, orange juice, bananas, teas, coffee, and a couple other things. The hotel is also within a 5-10 minute walk of a Safeway/ small shopping center with a nearby Subway. A liquor store and I-Hop are also within close walking distance. You can also take the shuttle to the airport and catch the metro to downtown Seattle for $5 round-trip. The trip downtown via metro takes about 45 minutes. CON: The only that disappointed me about this hotel was that it advertised a "fitness center" as an amenity. In reality, there were two elliptical machines and a stair stepper... no weights are provided. CONCLUSION: So, in all, this hotel is a great value and I absolutely would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I'm impressed even before we stay”
Reviews.Author: NancyLDelrayBeach_FL
Reviews.Content: When making our reservation for Sept 19, 2010 I goofed and didn't change the date in the reservation box which was the next day March 10, 2010. On March 11th I noticed the charge on my card and called. It was then that I realized that the fault was mine. They were very nice about it and gave me an immediate credit which they didn't have to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for travellers- NOT for tourists visiting Seattle”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTatonka
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was as travellers in transit heading to Syracuse. The staff went above and beyond to make our last night a memorable one. We opted to travel from Syracuse to Seattle as an affordable means to make it to Vancouver for the winter Olympics. The night we stayed at the hotel was the night of the Canada- USA hockey game (not the gold medal game but the first round game). We were able to watch the game with our family and the kids had a blast in the pool. When travelling in transit I am always frazzled trying to sort out the clothes, the tickets, what to keep on hand, etc. The staff made it very easy and with the helpful shuttle service added to our overall positive experience. In future we will consider doing the same trip in order to save on travel costs to Vancouver. As I mentioned in the title a great hotel if you are heading to Seatac, can't see it being a convenient spot if you want to visit Seattle from there. Thanks to the awesome staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Stay and Fly”
Reviews.Author: Kitters
Reviews.Content: We booked the Stay and Fly package at this hotel--stayed one night before flying out on a two week trip and leaving our car parked in their lot. The hotel is clean and comfortable and includes most amenities including a pool, restaurant and 24 hr. airport shuttle. We arrive about 6 p.m. and parked our car in their Stay and Fly lot which is well lighted and appeared to be well used as the lot was nearly full. The Boulevard Cafe inside the hotel offers a limited lunch and dinner menu and a free breakfast buffet. Since it was raining and we were taking an early flight we had dinner at the restaurant. It was quite satisfactory. The breakfast buffet opens early so that we were able to have breakfast before taking the 6 a.m. shuttle to the airport. When we returned 2 weeks later, our car was fine. Just a little dirty from sitting outside in the rain. We would definitely stay at this hotel again when flying from Seattle. If you are interested in the Stay and Fly package and plan to be gone more than a week, you will need to call the hotel direct. Their website does not list Stay and Fly packages for more than 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Mid range hotel with great polish”
Reviews.Author: taucias
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located roughly 3 miles south of the Seattle (SEA) Airport on International Boulevard, so it is very convenient for visiting business folks. The average room price when I visited was $70 a night. The hotel provided very comfortable and spotlessly clean rooms. The rooms were equiped with a refridgerator and were accessible from a corridoor, not externally. The hotel had a reasonable fitness room and a good quality indoor swimming pool. Free wireless internet was also available. There was a small hotel bar covering the basic drinks and the restaurant offered simple fare that was low cost but tasty. Typical menu options were pasta dishes, fish and chips and pizza. The free continental breakfast was also of good quality and offered cereals, waffles, breads and cakes, biscuits and gravy, eggs, fruit, etc. The location is safe for parking and not too noisy considering its proximity from the road. Given the option, I would definitely book a room at this place again. I was most impressed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in Seatac not Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DGLions
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here several times. This hotel is in Seatac and not Seattle. If if was in the proper city it would be #1. The top hotels in Seatac are nothing but dumps compared to the Bestwestern Executel. This is a very clean hotel, staff is always friendly and they have a fantastic free breakfast. It is also a Park and Fly airport which is another plus. I trust that Trip Advisor will put this hotel in the categorey that it belongs?

Reviews.Title: “Always Very Consistent”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th or 5th stay here and it is always very consistent. Clean rooms, no nonsense airport hotel. You simply can't beat the price, and the handy airport shuttle, free (hot!) breakfast, and free internet make it a tremendous value. If you're looking for fancy, look elsewhere. If you're looking for value, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: beaverwillows
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and found this place to be wonderful. Family of 5 accomodated well. Staff are great, Jacquie was just super. Great breakfast, best we have had while travelling the States. Shuttle bus is always available and the drivers are fantastic and very helpful - Dennys, IHOP and Safeway just up the road and we were dropped off and collected once we rang. Rooms clean and indoor pool, gym and internet access is a bonus. Had troubles flying out to Chicago for early morning flight and the staff welcomed us back to our old room until our flight left after lunch. Plane noise is minimal along with traffic as you are about 10 mins from airport. We also caught the light rail into the city to sight see and returned back to airport to be collected by hotel shuttle. Only 2 complaints - sheets smelt of bleach- very strong , but as least they were clean and also no laundry available onsite.

Reviews.Title: “sleep & fly plan: free 7-day parking, breakfast, internet, n' airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: kawa12
Reviews.Content: My family, 4 people, drove from Vancouver and stayed in this hotel in order to catch 8am flight to LA. We booked a sleep & fly plan, about $170 in total (1 room), from its official website. It includes 7 days outdoor parking (fee applies for additional day), 4 breakfasts, free wireless internet, free airport shuttle to/from the Sea-Tac Airport. There are many hotels near the Sea-Tac Airport and this hotel is about 15min drive from the airport. We only waited 15min for the shuttle to pick us up to the hotel on our way back home. Remember to ask the staff how to arrange for a shuttle back to the hotel or simply just grab a card from the reception. We had dinner at Subway locates a block from the hotel. The breakfast was good and starts at 5am!! It had waffles, muffins, bread, cereals, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. Btw, the beds were big enough for us to have 2 people in one bed. Cons: - the noise at night, but staying near the airport is what we wanted so it was not a big deal for us. - the heater was a li'l bit noisy at night. - the tap was like dripping (maybe only happened in our room) but the shower was great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a night stay”
Reviews.Author: burnaby5
Reviews.Content: As we are a family of five, it is always a little tricky to find accomodations. It wasn't a problem to book the sleep, fly, and park package for four, and pay $10 more to rent a roll away for the night for our fifth person, as well as $10 each night we were over the packaged parking allowment. A great price in total. Once we checked in; late evening, we realized our rollaway wasn't there, after inquiring it did finally come, I would call to confirm this next time, especially with a late arrival and early check out. With the early flight leaving from Seattle, it was great to have a complimentary breakfast and shuttle to the airport. There was an indoor pool that looked very inviting too. The parking was self parking, in a large lot behind the hotel. In the end I wasn't charged for the three extra nights parking. I think they only reserved the package, not the extras that I booked. After returning 11 days later- we just caught a taxi back - (it was under $10 for the fare part) our car was just fine-exactly how we left it. I would stay here again, it was great value, clean, and comfortable- for a nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel for Good Reason”
Reviews.Author: dogscout
Reviews.Content: I saw the reviews here on Trip Advisor and thought I would try this place. After driving 850 miles through the night I needed a pillow and a comfy bed. I called ahead to see about an early checkin. They accomodated me nicely even though I could tell throughout my day's stay that they were very busy with holiday travelers. I had dinner in their lounge. Food was good and seemed fresh, service from Derek was good as well, very friendly fellow. After dinner I enjoyed a couple of drinks from the bar with the bartender sending me back to my room with a full glass. I got up very early the next morning and had their hot breakfast that they started serving at 5 am. Im sure during the travel season people wouldnt mind breakfast at 430 epecially those heading to the airport. The food was good the bisquits and gravy was excellent!!! Oh did I forget to mention how cheap this place was compared to other like hotels in the area?? Yeah it was worth my money and I will definately go back in January.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent: Service, Staff, Fast shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: sunmun
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Nov. 26, 2009 to leave our car at hotel and fly in the morning. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Restaurant was closed for dinner I suppose because of Thanksgiving so have to go out to eat in pouring rain, a bit inconvenience. Breakfast was fine. Used business service without any disruptions. Shuttle service was great, in the morning waited for us to have breakfast and then dropped us at the airport, picked us up within 15 minutes after our call. Will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: KitsunePilot80
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends for a week in September for a convention over that weekend. We loved the hotel overall; breakfast was wonderful (especially the biscuits and gravy), the restaurant had good food for dinner, front desk staff was very helpful about passing on bus schedule information to the best of their knowledge and the shuttle drivers were absolutely wonderful to talk to and joke with each ride (since the four of us went back and forth from the airport several times that week). The room was very clean, only one minor maintenance issue that has probably been solved by now - the smoke detector was hanging loose like someone had tried to get up and take the battery out. It still worked fine as the steam from our bathroom set it off. Only had one minor issue with housekeeping in the last two days we were there, and that was one of my friend's energy drinks went missing, and another friend's washcloth went missing. The cloth was a completely different fabric and look than the ones at the hotel, and was buried deep within her bathroom/soap items. Overall, I would suggest this hotel. Quiet, clean, friendly staff, nothing too big to worry about and close to the airport with free shuttle service and a cheap bus ride into the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, no frills, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BronwenL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite close to the airport and very conveniently located to the Fox car rental. Both the airport and Fox have free airport shuttles. This hotel is not really close to any attractions or eateries other than a little steakhouse/bar and IHOP, and an on-site restaurant with limited hours. It's located about 25 minutes from Seattle and 20 minutes from Tacoma which we found convenient but could be annoying if you were expecting to be in or near either city. The hotel is fairly old but it's well maintained and clean. The rooms are comfortable and do well for business or leisure travel. Certainly fair value for the money. The staff were very pleasant at the hotel and the breakfast was excellent with DIY waffles! We enjoyed our stay but would probably pick somewhere else if we were going solely for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great Price!”
Reviews.Author: RomanticoYcheapo
Reviews.Content: Good place for airport stayovers. Clean, comfortable rooms. Better than average breakfast. Centrally-located Business center to do online check-in and print boarding passes. Great price, too! (I paid more for a far poorer place the previous night.) Shuttle was quick. BEWARE: shuttle leaves hotel every half hour, on the half hour. They take reservations - be sure to get one when you check in. Free wireless internet. A bit understaffed? The woman who checked us in at 9pm was NOT in a good mood. I asked "Worked a long day?" She replied "Since this morning". Then, she was there for my 7am checkout! Poor thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain for a decent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JTHONOLULU
Reviews.Content: Had to go for Family Business from Hawaii to Orlando- Stopped at a layover in Seattle on Alaska Air to spend the night and break up the long flight time. We stayed at this Best Western on the way out and then opted for it again on the way back. It was more economical than the others in the airport area and had free shuttle service to and from the Airport. The kingsize bed was very comfy and the Shower was nice becuase it had SPA-like dispensors for the shampoo, soap and conditioner- (I hate those teeny tiny bottles) There is Free Wi-FI and a small gym and pool spa area. There is a fridge and coffee/tea maker in the room. We were surprised to see a large number of cable channels were also free. Another perk was the free breakfast area. (the Make your waffle machine was fun) and there are all sorts of goodies to have along with free coffee teas and juices. There is however no regular resturaunt or one close by. You would need to take the shuttle or have a rental car. This hotel is great as an overnight stay between planes.

Reviews.Title: “Good place and nice room with blankets”
Reviews.Author: Lordthunder
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and blankets were very nice. There was a spare blanket in the room cool. Also shuttle schedule with Nelson Shuttle Service at [--] was excellent. I used the spare blanket very clean for a Best Western 5 stars on clean rooms. Also a very good cleaning staff in are room. One suggest is wish they would put two spare Blankets in the rooms someday. Since the room had two queen beds. The indoor pool was great with Hot tub. Also staff is very friendly and helpful. Also, had to verify with celebrity what pier for Nelson Shuttle service since Best Western wrote down the wrong pier information from pier 91 to Pier 66. I am glad i change this information since Best Western wrote down the wrong pier information for the driver. Other than that a good place to stay from the Airport Seattle. I would stay there again. Nice food near by too.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: sherrijan
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was functional but rather small and had a very strong deodrant smell to it. I would not recommend staying here if you have allergies. The hotel is close by the airport and convenient when you need to stay over night and fly. There is a nice computer room where you can print your boarding passes etc. There is no fast food or convenience stores located anywhere near the hotel. The hotel does have its own restaurant prices not that bad. They do have a great breakfast with cereal, muffins, waffels and baking powder biscuits and gravy and its all very clean and orderly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the sleep and fly”
Reviews.Author: kosmo56
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the 3rd time. Great if you are wanting to stay and park and then head out to another location. They take you to the airport and then pick you up when you come back. So far no problems with the car while sitting there. Breakfast is included, which is ok. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect "night before flight" hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmweis1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel since we had an early morning flight out of Sea-Tac airport. It's a very basic hotel, but we were able to get a room over night and park our car for a week for $120. The shuttle to and from the airport was on time and their free continental breakfast was awesome with waffles, bagels, cereal, etc. After the trip we got back to our car and it was just as we left it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel outside of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: diy200701
Reviews.Content: This is an old, very average hotel. The only positive about this hotel is that it's minutes from the airport and has a complimentary shuttle. This was the reason we booked this hotel since we had a 6AM flight. However, there is nothing around the hotel and it's 25-30 minutes from downtown Seattle. You need to call the cab from the hotel, and the ride one-way will cost around $45. We took a bus a few times, but it takes an hour to get to Seattle. Do not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a layover”
Reviews.Author: kentucky1937
Reviews.Content: All, if not most of the hotels along the International Blvd. strip cater to those who are going to catch a flight or have just arrived from elsewhere, so they are "one night stays". The breakfast was free, although nothing fancy. They run constant shuttle service to the airport which is what you are looking for. Staff is indifferent, but basically efficient. This hotel has several wings which tend to be a confusing layout and I believe there is only one elevator. Good value for the purpose intended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: Geneseo04
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of several hotels in the area, we chose to stay here. The rate for a Queen was almost $80 a night cheaper than in the city. Also, parking is free which saved about $20-30 a night. The room was clean and quiet. The front desk was helpful with any question we had, and they had a bowl of complimentary Washington Apples! Breakfast in the morning was also free, and they had a good amount of food! Staying at this hotel was also 30 minutes closer to Forks, which saved us time. There wasn't a lot in the area- you really need a car to do anything. But it was only 20 minutes from the city, so it ended up working out! Finally, we really appreciated the business center. There were 3 computers with Free Internet Access and access to printing for Free! This is an incredible luxury in most hotels- we were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure stay waiting for Alaska cruise”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler2000
Reviews.Content: Got van from motel at airport. Got a nice room and had an inexpensive meal. Area not best (Green River Murders) but just staying one night before a cruise. Desk arranged for pvt shuttle to docks at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the pool or fitness room”
Reviews.Author: Washboardmary
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel near the airport because it had a pool and fitness room. The rate is good and the room was comfortable and clean, no problems there. The free breakfast is nice and there was a wide selection of different foods available. However, the fitness room and pool leave something to be desired. The fitness room is the walk thru area before you reach the pool or exit the pool, so the floor was wet, the kids played on the machines (that is an issue with the parents and not the hotel), the room was a balmy 80 degrees and there was no fan. The TV has no remote and the channel can't be changed and there are no anti-spetic wipes for the machines. Most people would not be bothered by any of these issues, but for the die-hard exerciser (like me), it was a touch disappointing. If you don't exercise, then this is a great hotel and I really recommend it for the close proximity to SEATAC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: muddblood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights while we toured around seattle. We got an excellent rate and it meet all our expectations. The kids loved the pool, which we spent way more time in then planned. The breakfast was good lots of selection and the kids loved the make your own waffle. My only complaint would be the sausage gravy and biscuits which were some super extra salty concoction, but easy enough to avoid with the other selections that were available. The rooms were reasonable quiet, minimal plane or traffic noise. The air conditioner below the window was louder that we are use to, so we just had to remember to turn the air conditioning unit to sleep and the fan on low at night. I would not hesitate to stay here again, This is a fairly basic hotel with a few extras, and excellent value that we found unbeatable. If you book online directly with Best Western, they will beat any online price by 10%, you just have to send them an email with a link to the lower price.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tigglet
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good continental breakfast.,and had very clean rooms. As far as the location,hardly any resturaunts.Not the best area,saw a prositute from time to time walking the streets. The hotel was pretty noisy,could here the people next door and across the way. They said we would get a queen bed,so do not believe that.We ended up with a full bed,and was very uncomfortable,hard as a rock!!! The room was extremely small,but had a large bathroom. Instead of it being called the "Best Western" it should have been called the "Worst Western". Never again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: titus1
Reviews.Content: We needed to be on an early flight. This hotel ended up being really excellent. The room was impeccably clean and quiet. The restaurant was fine. Nothing special but not over priced and gave a tired traveler a good meal. The pool and hot tub were fun for my son. We got on the shuttle in the morning after a good buffet with eggs, waffles and all that one would need. Staff were polite and friendly. For the price it seemed a very good deal indeed. I would stay there again when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: lwbadgr
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised at how quiet the rooms were, given its proximity to the airport, but it was great. We both slept well, despite not being able to get a flat pillow from room service. You could barely hear the planes. Administration was great with email alerts, receipts, etc. Housekeeping was good. The floor was a little creaky where the wings joined. They have 3 computers in their business center, but could use more. They were constantly being used - at all hours of the day. Hotel offers a great breakfast (free). Biscuits and gravy, pancakes, fruit, cereal... everything!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: traveleaze
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, they let me come and check in at 9am when I was just off a cruise ship. The room was large, clean, comfortable. The staff helped with getting me a rental car, bus info, restaurants, etc. Then, in the morning I had to leave at 4am and the shuttle bus was on time and courteous. Even dropped me off at ticketing. I could not have asked for more. Although I didn't use it there was a gym, pool, and am breakfast! I highly recommend this hotel. It is located near the airport so I needed a rental car to go downtown, but this was not a problem at all. There was a car rental within walking distance to the hotel. Also, they have a room with computers and internet. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great pick if you want to stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: seyyah_2009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were arriving in the evening from a long flight and wanted to rest for a night close to the airport (and don't pay the very high in-city rates). The hotel met that expectation perfectly. The rooms are spacious, there is a clean and good restaurant on site and the complimentary breakfast is really really good. For those who might want to work on site, hotel has a good business center and complimentary internet connection. We also found the room rate to be very reasonable. However if you want to stay right in the center of the city, don't stay here as taxi costs around $50 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Large nice room, quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: alaskanfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about a week while preparing for an exam. The location was close to the airport and the hotel was quiet. Nice large room with a king size (?) bed, large chair and desk, The room also had a small fridge in which I was able to stock up with cold drinks and snacks for long nights. The room was located on the back side of the hotel which most likely was a lot quieter then the front side, which borders International. Hotel staff was friendly, and the breakfast was your standard Best Western, good for a day or two and then you will want probably something different. The swimming pool, fitness area and hot tub was adequate, but nothing great. The computer room was a nice touch, as it allowed me to print off a few things, including my boarding passes. It is a little further down the road then most of the hotels directly outside the airport, but only by a couple minutes. I would definitely stay here again when traveling through Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “another great park and fly experience”
Reviews.Author: FP4BMO
Reviews.Content: In the past 12 months we have stayed at this hotel on 4 different occassions and on 3 of those times we have encouraged friends and family to stay there as well for ease of coordinating schedules and airport transfers. This time was no exception. We like to fly out of Seatac instead of YVR as there is significant cost savings, even when figuring in the overnight hotel stay. We stayed during spring break for one night and parked our car for the 8 days we were away, $129usd before taxes, a great park and fly rate. It seemed a little noisier this time, people walking upstairs, probably with kids out of school and travelling during the break, no big deal. The front desk is pleasant, we always look for Jenni as she has a great personality and is always polite. The restaurant serves a good dinner at a reasonable price. We had a two queen room with frig. The room as before was clean, bathroom in good repair, adequate temperature control, comfortable beds with clean sheets and lots of pillows. My son enjoys the pool, it is indoors and heated, a nice way to tire him out before bedtime. We organized the airport shuttle the night before and were able to use the computer room facilities to print off the boarding passes, both nice touches at no extra charge. The next morning we took advantage of the included breakfast, again, it was very ggod with waffles, toast, eggs, cereal and the night before. Our shuttle picked us up at the determined time and Bob the driver was quite funny with his one liners and other play on word jokes. The pick up at the end of our trip was equally smooth. This is a motel in the airport district, it is not a 5 star hotel but it treats it guests as if it were. We will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dforce
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised on my recent business trip to Seattle. I stayed at the Best Western Airport Executel Hotel in Seattle. While this hotel does not look like much on the outside, the interior paints a completely different picture. The check-in was very quick and efficient. The Front Desk staff were polite and professional and answered all questions with ease. The rooms are very clean and feature white linens. They don't have flat screen televisions but that is a minor issue to me. If you're an aviation fan like me, you can also get good views of aircraft that have just taken off from Seattle Airport. The breakfast was outstanding and a little bit more than the standard Best Western breakfast. The restaurant on-site provides good food at a reasonable price. If you're looking for a hotel that provides good quality and value for your travel needs whether it's a night before a flight or a meeting at a nearby hotel, I would come back to the Best Western. They also have a great swimming pool inside to relax at the end of a long day. I also loved that you can park your car for free while staying there. I can't stand having to pay to park at a hotel. The only downside is that there aren't many things located in the vicinity of the hotel but that's very much the case for most of the airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “lousy service”
Reviews.Author: psylocke
Reviews.Content: I researched which hotel to stay at in this area, as we were flying out of Seatac in the morning, and made my decision based upon this hotel having cribs available. I even had someone from the best western call center call the hotel and check in advance before making the reservation. I requested a crib for my 6 month old son, when I made the online reservation, and was told upon check-in that it would take 15 minutes to get one. We waited over 2 hours, until 11pm, during which time we made a few calls to the front desk, and finally found out that there was no crib available. We had to seek this information out ourselves, as we did not get a call telling us this. We asked for assistance in tearing down the second bed in our room so that our son could sleep on the mattress, as the bed was too high and dangerous for him to sleep on, and we were told that they could not help us. There was no apology made, in fact I was told that we should have come earlier to get available cribs, even though I had requested one in advance. In the morning, I spoke to a nice woman in guest services who was very apologetic, and we were given a mere $25 dollars off of our park and fly room which was $144. Our young son was kept up until after 11pm, and we could not sleep all night worrying about him falling off of the mattress he was sleeping on. I was not impressed with the service we received that night, and as a result, cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: InvRalph
Reviews.Content: I went to Seattle for businesss, naturally taking my wife. I noted some minor poor reviews regarding the Executel on researching hotels close to Seatac, but we always had good luck at Best Western hotels. We could not have been more pleased. The hotel itself was quite clean and inviting. The room was really nice and the TV had more than 12 stations. It seems that the hotel may have been renovated and the entire experience was more than satisfactory. We used the computer room and found it fully stocked and we were able to get boarding passes for the return flight and check email with no problem. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The on site restaurant is more than adequate. The bill of fare was varied and the food outstanding. There is a complimentary morning continental breakfast that is deceiving. It is not strictly a continental breakfast, but not quite a full hot breakfast. It was very good. Hot self made waffles, bisquits and gravy, hot or cold cereal, juices, fresh fruit, coffee/tea, and the like. When we return to Seattle we will most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: deeharleygal
Reviews.Content: We always use this hotel when traveling out of the Sea-Tac airport. On line reservations are great and we can park and fly. They are great about getting you to the airport and picking you up when you arrive. One trick I have found is to call the day you are arriving to get a shuttle time to the airport, especially if you have an early flight. Rooms are clean and location is close to the airport. Bar is open until 10pm and I believe the resturant is open until 10pm also. Breakfast comes with the room and starts at 5am, however, we have never been able to eat, since we always have a 6am flight. Rooms are clean and are comfortable. Price is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for park and fly stay”
Reviews.Author: DebAndKev
Reviews.Content: We drove down from Vancouver to fly out of Seattle for our trip to Turks & Caicos, so we decided to stay the night before so we could do a park & fly package. It was a great deal and saved us so much money over parking at the airport. We had a first floor room with a patio door, which was great. There's only a few of these. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Check-in was easy, and service was friendly. I did hear some guests upstairs showering and walking around early in the morning, but I'm a light sleeper I guess, as my husband heard nothing. They have a rather nice little indoor pool and hottub with glass windows and a patio (for summer). We didn't have time to swim, but it looked clean and inviting. The hotel included breakfast which was buffet style and quite good. They even had a waffle maker, which my husband enjoyed. The shuttle ran every 15 minutes, so we booked the time the night before. It wasn't crowded. On our return we called for a shuttle and it was there in about 10 minutes. Our vehicle was just fine. It was parked right next to the hotel, so it's quite a busy area. If you don't leave any valuables in iy you should be fine. All in all it was a great choice for an airport park & fly hotel, and we'd absolutely stay again if we once again fly out of Seattle. This is the second Best Western we stayed at since since Dec. and I am liking the chain so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & will try many other Best Westerns”
Reviews.Author: Meesch13
Reviews.Content: We Read no reviews, choose hotel due to price, pool, & close to airport w/hot deluxe breakfast. (waffles yum!!) We were very comfortable here. Pool & jacuzzui very nice. Sauna not so much, never got hot. All updated, clean rooms. As far as noise Heard only one plane not bad at all. We were happy & will not hesitate to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Never come back”
Reviews.Author: Sunrising88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on Dec. 15. We were taking the morning flight to Las Vegas. I have to say this is the worst experience with Best Western we have ever had. First of all, the heater was broken at late night so that we were too cold to sleep any longer. The hotel did not provide any quilt but a very thin blanket. We were almost frozen. Secondly, the breakfast was not good at all, few choices, no bacon or sauge or ham, and the hot water was not hot enough for oatmeal. In comparison, the Best Western in Redding is too good to be true.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave your car!”
Reviews.Author: watraveler49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western the night before we flew out of Seatac. We left our car in the lot and paid the Park n' Fly rate. We came home a week later to a shattered rear car window. When asked about the last time something like this had happened, I was told, " Not for quite a while, at least a week". If I had seen that on trip advisor, I would have chosen a different hotel. The management was compassionate and, far too easily, found duct tape and plastic to secure the window.
