No other efforts were made on our behalf. Our stay at the Best Western turned out to be much more expensive than the cost of the room. Stay only if you don't plan to park in the lot overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport travel plans.”
Reviews.Author: Beachie13
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel whenever I'm taking an early morning flight. It's close to the airport and has a 24 hr. free shuttle. The rooms are quite adequate, very clean and affordable. There is also a great continental breakfast included. Not just left over pastries and terrible coffee.....real food and a good selection. Also, there is an attached restaurant, closer to cafe style, has a good menu to choose from and a bar. This is a great place to stay, especially if you're trying to be near the airiport.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Airport-Room choice hit or miss!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay 24 October 2008 (room 16) and 26 October 2008 (room 180) I stayed here after flying in and before flying out during my weekend adventure to Vancouver, BC. I found a great, non stop roundtrip airfare from Orlando to Seattle and decided to visit Vancouver-I visited Seattle a few years ago. I highly recommend this hotel if you are flying in late or leaving early or both like I did. It's not as close, noisy, or overpriced as the ones closer like the Hampton Inn. I will definitely consider this place if/when I return to Seattle and need somewhere near the airport. I would have given this hotel a 3.5 for room #16 but a 4.5 for room #180 so my rating overall is a 4! The front desk was very helpful. Guy on first night very nice and blocked room for my return stay when I complained about noise and location of Room #16. Lady on second night very helpful and friendly despite Fox News Channel on lobby tv. Free Airport Shuttle great! I dropped off the rental car on return and was picked up at Thrifty Rental Car place in less than 10 minutes. Shuttle to airport on last morning was great and on time as well-tell them when you need to leave-they depart every half hour in the morning. Breakfast not the best-they had boiled eggs which appeared to be preboiled somewhere else and then packaged to be reheated in hot water-they were like rubber. They had waffles, juice, coffee, and all the usual. I don’t remember any meat-think they had some sausage gravy but not sure. It was a very basic no-frills breakfast. Both rooms-2 queen sized beds-ok-4 pillows each-form rubber not firm enough for me. TV with over 70 channels, chest of drawers (3 drawers) under tv for storage, refrigerator, coffee/tea maker with ample supplies. Shower only. No toiletries except one bar of soap. Soap, shower, and conditioner dispenser in shower-there was sign saying more supplies available at front desk, if needed. Chair and table-no desk-no safe. a/c ok did job not too noisy. Occassional plane passing over-but you're staying near the airport so expected. Room #16-backside lowest level of hotel over looking parking lot-nothing special but did the job. Room needs a little more lighting or brighter bulbs. Water in shower fluctuates between very hot and lukewarm-can be dangerous. Room #180-much better-at end of hall on first floor (really 2nd floor). Quieter and larger than room #16-more open space but same furniture set up. Good view to side/back of hotel-trees with autumn leaves (see recent reviewer’s photo) -100 yards of open space then some houses. Common areas: 3 free Internet terminals with printer in secure locked room accessible by room key. Pool and exercise room looked fine but didn’t use. Parking an issue on first stay-hotel overbooked. Second stay plenty of parking but didn’t have car since I returned it on arrival. One reviewer complained about long walk to room-it’s worth it to stay in Room #180 or nearby. Hotel totally smoke free and didn’t see any cheaters or evidence thereof. If you are going to stay there and arrive late (or even if you are going to arrive early), call the hotel directly and ask them to block off a room at the end of the back hallway for you. Staying on the bottom level was not pleasant-felt like I was staying in someone’s basement. Hotel felt very safe-never saw any questionable characters but they can be anywhere. Tip: If you have transportation, have dinner at Butler’s Bar and Grill, 22341 Marine View Dr, in Des Moines, WA. It’s just over 2 miles from the hotel. I’m sure they can provide directions at the hotel or call the restaurant. They are currently in the Delta Dining Guide so I earned some SkyMiles and had a great meal-the prawns and calamari are great!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to a return stay”
Reviews.Author: mladabol
Reviews.Content: Convenient, comfortable, friendly, clean - and the clam chowder in the restaurant is the best I've ever had anywhere! I look forward to the next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprising: good stays both times”
Reviews.Author: Rapublico
Reviews.Content: The Executel is a typical airport style hotel/motel property, so if that fits your traveling style, you will probably get what you expect, and may even be pleasantly surprised, as I was. I stayed here both pre and post cruise, so had two different rooms, and each time they were both very clean and tastefully done, having been newly remodeled. The were fairly large too. The breakfast wasn’t gourmet but was enough to get you going and last until lunch, although heavy on the starch (waffles, biscuits & gravy, toast). Boiled eggs and apples/bananas were served too. The staff were really helpful giving all sorts of information. They recommended and reserved a restaurant (providing free shuttle van) that was located right on the waterfront, making for a perfect Seattle setting on our last night. The only fault is that the hallways desperately need to be remodeled. On the first stay, when walking to my room down the drab, tattered carpet, scratched up hallway, I was very apprehensive of what the room would be like. But as mentioned, my fears were unfounded once I opened the door. Would I stay there again? If I need a decent place at a decent price, I wouldn’t hesitate to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TXLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this Best Western and it is a decent place to stay. The room was clean and comfortable, as were the beds. It is close to airport and has a free shuttle. It offers fruit, cereal, can make your own waffles, biscuits, sausage gravy, juice and coffee for breakfast. Would stay again at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: rinjates
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on September 15th 2008. I booked a "reverse park & stay" meaning that we parked our vehicle in the hotel lot and flew out of Sea-Tac airport, when we returned to Sea-Tac, we stayed a night at the hotel. All of the hotels in the area offer these deals, I suggest that you consider other hotels before staying here. When we arrived at the hotel after 10 nights in Hawaii we checked into our room. My wife immediately noticed that the toilet seat was dirty. I reported this to the front desk and they moved us to a different room. When I went out to check on my vehicle I discovered that it had been broken into sometime while we were away. Nothing was taken, but there was about $1000 damage. I reported this to the hotel front desk person and he seemed indifferent. After looking around at thier long term parking area it became clear to my why my vehicle was not safe there. Thier parking area sits lower than the main street outside, so there is no line of sight into the parking lot from the roadway. Also the area is very poorly lit - a fact I could not have known when I first parked there in the daytime. If staying at one of these park & stay hotels be sure to have a good look around at the parking lot first. This hotel was not very impressive at all, which is unfortunate because I have always relied on the Best Western name when I see one in an unfamiliar town. I will not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JJDB1400
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel to stay in. I was a little worried, being that it was near the airport, but it was very nice, very clean, and the staff was very friendly. The rooms had great beds and wonderful pillows. The bathroom was super clean and modern. The free continental breakfast was great, with fresh waffles, cereals, biscuits and gravy, etc. The only thing we didn't like was that there were no stores of any kind nearby. You couldn't walk anywhere if you needed anything. We needed a market or store, and walked a bit, but there was nothing within walking distance. Other than that, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “locked out of our room”
Reviews.Author: NCDL
Reviews.Content: July 8, 2008 Up until getting locked out of our room on a Saturday morning, 6/21/08, before going to the airport , we had a good night at the Best Western Executel in Seattle. I was eating breakfast and my husband came from exercising to tell me that his key was not working. My key also failed. The two staff at the desk were very polite and tried their keys which also failed. They explained that there was NO maintainence worker at the hotel on weekends and both the owner AND the manager were not on site. There was NO ONE AT THE HOTEL with access to the master key. We had planned out time carefully to eat, shower, refuel and return our rental car before we boarded our plane back to NC. Suddenly we were in panic mode as we realized the depth of our problem. It is clear that the owner of this privately owned Best Western, Nadeem, does NOT TRUST his staff as he does not give them access to a master key. We believe this is a liability issue to put hotel guests in possible danger when no one can enter a room. What a baby had been locked in when a mom ran to the ice machine? What if someone was ill in the room? The manager was called to come in and was said to live "10 minutes away". He came 50 minutes later and told us "we did not have anything to worry about" as he got the master key and simply unlocked the door. Wasn't that easy for him to say? He had not stood outside of the room sweating in exercise clothes worrying if he could shower, pack, clean and gas the car and board the plane in time. How dare he tell us we need not worry! It was the wrong thing to say and I told him so. He should have come immediately to the hotel and then apologized. We told him we did not want to pay for our night and he accepted that. We told him that the staff had been very caring but they were put in a terrible situation having to tell their guests they could not get access to a locked room. Best Westerns are now privately owned and this type of thing is a serious problem as there are no corporate policies which prevent it. We contacted the customer service dept. but they can only speak to Nadeem the owner who made it clear he did not want the staff to have access to the master key "because it may get lost" Has he heard of making a duplicate? It would simpler than having a dangerous situation at the hotel. If he does not trust his staff, he should not keep the hotel open. We left 50 minutes late to the airport where we had to run to our gate and we quite stressed after a nice vacation. It could have been so different. Deb L

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: mama40
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Executel one night as we had a connecting flight at 5am the next morning. When picked up at the airport by the free shuttle, we were so pleased with the service and the humor our driver displayed. Wonderful trip to the hotel. Check in was a breeze, and the front desk staff was kind and funny. The hotel is quite a maze...got lost twice! The lounge serves a small but good menu, and the woman tending the bar was great. The room was clean, the bed was comfy, dipped a bit to much in the middle, but we were only sleeping for 4 hours so it didnt matter at all. Only complaint, we asked for a 2am wakeup call,....that didnt come! Good thing Hubby has a natural clock in his head. There is also an alarm clock for backup in the room, but every clock seems to be different so setting them can be hit and miss for me. In the morning, our shuttle driver was there, right on time, and confessed that it was he that forgot out wakeup call, he felt very bad about it, gave us a breakfast basket for the road and took us right to the door where we needed to check in at the airport. He was forgiven! All in all, a great place to stay, and we will do it again next time in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Not convient for morning fliers or those without a car”
Reviews.Author: SteveinPhilly
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for the night before our flight home from Seattle after a cruise. Our flight was at 9am and so we figured it was easier to stay near Seatac the night before. The rate was also cheaper than in Seattle city center. I booked on Best Westerns website and paid about $89. for one night.. a Monday night. We arrived at about 3pm at the airport (via cab from downtown because of the flat rate). The shuttle picked us up promptly. We realized as we headed to the hotel that this was the LAST hotel on the Airport hotel strip. We asked the shuttle driver about food for dinner. He pointed out that the hotel restaurant was closed Mondays and that there was only an IHOP within walking distance. Check in was easy with an efficient desk clerk. She asked if we needed a shuttle in morning to airport and we said yes. We had separate flights at 8:40 and 9:00 am. We were told the shuttle runs every half hour on the half hour. We asked for 6:30 for one of us and 7am for the other. The desk person said that the 6:30 was full (They only have one van and it holds 12 people). One of us had to leave at 6am. So if you plan to use the shuttle, this is not the most convenient hotel. I then went to use the pool and spa. The pool was fine (both are indoor) but spa out of order. Next was dinner. I did hear that there was a Safeway nearby and figured we could make sandwiches. It is about ¼ mile walk but it’s huge so that was backup plan. Room was clean and had nice bed and TV with 99 (!) cable channels. The walls can be thin and sound travels. Ask for quiet room. The business center has three PCS and printer that you can use (when others aren’t). Breakfast started at 5am that was good and free breakfast had waffles, hardboiled eggs, cereal and bagels plus juice and coffee. I was pleased. So, I’d give it a pretty good rating if you have a car to go eat and if you want convenient service to airport. (I suggested to BW that they have a back up shuttle during morning peak hours). If flying in at night you might be waiting a while at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Airport Executel is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Iwilder
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this motel at the conclusion of our cruise. It far exceeded our expectations. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was very good, in fact the best "self service" breakfast buffett I've ever had at a motel. The transportation to the airport was wonderful, prompt, professional and not intimidated by our 20+ bags plus walker and wheelchair.! I highly recommend this motel as very good value.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Airport Executel
HotelInfo.Address: 20717 International Blvd, Seattle, WA 98003
